title: Chinese Almond Cookies
steps: Place almond flour, salt, and chilled butter cubes into an electric mixer with paddle attachment. Beat on medium speed for 3 minutes until coarse and chunky.
Add 1 egg (50g) and almond extract. Mix on low speed until just incorporated.
Sift together all-purpose flour, sugar, and baking soda. Add to mixture and mix on low speed until just combined.
Flatten dough into a disc, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Beat the remaining egg (50g) in a small bowl.
Roll dough into balls about ¾ inch wide. Place on baking sheet about 1 inch apart.
Press down slightly with your palm to make a coin shape.
Press one sliced almond into the center of each cookie.
Using a pastry brush or finger, paint each cookie with beaten egg for a lacquered appearance.
Bake at 325°F for 13-15 minutes until edges just begin to tan.
Cool on the sheet on a wire rack.
notes: Volume conversions: 1⅓ cups almond flour ≈ 130g, 1 cup butter (2 sticks) = 227g, 2 large eggs ≈ 100g, 1 tsp almond extract ≈ 5g, 1¾ cups flour ≈ 210g, 1 cup + 2 tbsp sugar ≈ 225g, ½ tsp baking soda ≈ 3g
Cook time is per batch - baking all 60 cookies will take about 1 hour if doing one sheet at a time
Dough must chill for 2 hours before baking
Egg wash gives cookies a shiny, lacquered finish
